ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Not only did we learn lyric writing and dramatic architecture by one of the best lyricists in the business, but also we learned about the business of theatre making. It's a refreshing practical class.

This class begins by covering the nitty gritty and semantics (rhyming and scansion and things) but quickly moves on to more macro-level stuff about how to craft a large work of musical theater. If you're looking for a songwriting workshop, this class won't always meet your needs. If you want to learn how to write and structure a show, this is a great place to start.
I learned to write lyrics for musical theater. Specifically, I was exposed to the various genres of musical lyrics writing through examples.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: I don't have any suggestions. I enjoyed it as was.

Best thing about this class is the feedback. Professor Korie gives very detailed notes on songs and makes himself available to talk in person about your work. I always had an idea of what I could do better next time.
More assignments should be given to increase our familiarity with lyrics writing and our repertoire of lyrics. All the guest speakers were wonderful additions to the already very interesting class.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes. Even if you don't have a musical theater background, lyrics are so ubiquitous, and Michael so accommodating to taste and style, that it's a no brainer.

I would definitely recommend this course to another student. Michael Korie is a great teacher, and the assignments are fun, creative, and interesting. I loved working on my songs every week, and will miss having this fun creative outlet.
Take this class if you want to write better songs that fit better together!
Yes. I would strongly recommend this class to students who are interested to learn and develop their craft in lyrics writing.
